trans-unit.source: Contains the fields from a parsed resource expression.
When a page is parsed, the values contained in a resource expression are parsed and stored in an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields> class.

This <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields> object contains two fields, <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A>.
These fields are drawn from the values of a resource expression in either the explicit (`<%$ Resources: ClassKey, ResourceKey %>`) or implicit (`meta:resourcekey="ResourceKey"`) form.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> property identifies the class name of a resource that is mapped to a resource file.

For example, to reference a resource file named Financial.resx, or a localized version such as Financial.en-GB.resx, the resource expression would appear as `<%$ Resources: Financial, ResourceKey %>`.
After parsing, the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> property would return "Financial" as its value.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A> property identifies the particular key/value pair to be retrieved from the file.
If the Financial.resx file contains a key called `Currency`, that value could be specified with the resource expression `<%$ Resources: Financial, Currency %>`.
After parsing, the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A> property would return "Currency" as its value.
The resource expression is parsed through the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionBuilder.ParseExpression%2A> method.
Sensitive information should not be stored in a resource file.
Gets the class key for a parsed resource expression.
This method returns the class key for a parsed resource expression.
The class key represents the name of the resource file, and is the value specified before the comma (,) in an expression of the form `<%$ Resources: [Namespace.]ClassKey, ResourceKey $>`.
A namespace value for the resource class is optional.
When a namespace is provided, the namespace and the class key are returned in the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> property.
The class key cannot contain spaces or double-byte character sets (DBCS).
To reference a resource file named Financial.resx or a localized version such as Financial.en-GB.resx, you would include the resource expression <`%$ Resources: Financial, ResourceKey %>`.
After parsing, the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> property would return "Financial" as its value.
Sensitive information should not be stored in a resource file.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the class key, or <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> if the class key has not been set.
Gets the resource key for a parsed resource expression.
This method returns the resource key for a parsed resource expression.
The resource key is the value specified after the comma (,) in an expression of the form `<%$ Resources: ClassKey, ResourceKey %>`.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A> property identifies a particular key/value pair within the resource file mapped to the class key.
For example, if a file named Financial.resx contains a key called `Currency`, that value could be specified with the resource expression `<%$ Resources: Financial, Currency %>`.
After parsing, the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A> property would return "Currency" as its value.
Sensitive information should not be stored in a resource file.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the resource key, or <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> if the resource key has not been set.
